thread.title: Botetourt inmate discovered hanging and unresponsive in his cell
thread.title_full: Botetourt inmate discovered hanging and unresponsive in his cell

author: Samantha Becker
title: Botetourt inmate discovered hanging and unresponsive in his cell
text: An inmate at the Botetourt-Craig Regional Jail was discovered unresponsive in his cell on Tuesday, officials say. The inmate was found hanging from a bed sheet wrapped around part of his cell bunk from an apparent suicide. SEE ALSO: Second man arrested in connection to Franklin County murder, Sheriff's Office says At around 4:28 p.m., deputies made their routine checks and found no signs of distress. The inmate was found unresponsive hanging in his cell during a second check just a few minutes later at 4:32 p.m. Officials say the inmate was pronounced dead at the scene and transported to the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner in Roanoke for an autopsy. The inmate was being held in the Botetourt-Craig Regional Jail for 10 counts of possession of obscene material involving a minor. According to the Botetourt County Sheriff's Office, \"Deputies conduct routine checks of all inmates twice an hour to ensure their safety and well-being. An investigation into the incident is being conducted. No foul play is suspected, and the inmate was housed alone in a secure cell at the time of the incident. As is our standard practice, the Virginia State Police and the Commonwealthâ€™s Attorney have been asked to conduct an independent review of the investigation.\"
